info.title: Available API endpoints
info.description: VersionEye is a cross-platform search engine for free/libre/open source software libraries.

get.description:
This endpoint shows all imported repositories from your Github account.

This enpoint expects that you have a GitHub account connected and the token
is still valid. If that is not the case please visit **https://www.versioneye.com/settings/connect**.
to update your GitHub credentials.

If it shows no or old data, then you can use the `github/sync` endpoint
to update your account with the current meta data from GitHub.

post.description: This endpoint is registered as service hook on GitHub. It triggers a project re-parse on each git push.

get.description:
Reimports ALL GitHub Repositories. This Endpoint fetches meta information to all
repositories in your GitHub account. Meta information such as repo name, branches and
supported project files.

This endpoint works asynchronously and returns a status code. The status code is either
**running** or **done**.

get.summary: shows the detailed information for the repository
get.description:
This Endpoint returns detailed information about a GitHub repository.

Due the limits of our current API framework, the repo key has to be
encoded as url-safe string. That means all '/' has to be replaced with
colons ':' and '.' has to be replaced with '~'.

For example,  repository with fullname `versioneye/veye` has to transformed
to `versioneye:veye`.

parameters.name: repo_key
parameters.description: encoded repo name with optional branch info.

200.description: shows the detailed information for the repository

post.description:
Use this Endpoint to import a project file from GitHub. This will create a new project on VersionEye.

Due the limits of our current API framework, the repo key has to be
encoded as url-safe string. That means all '/' has to be replaced with
colons ':' and '.' has to be replaced with '~'.

For example,  repository with fullname `versioneye/veye` has to transformed
to `versioneye:veye`.

delete.description:
This Endpoint deletes a project on VersionEye!

Due the limits of our current API framework, the repo key has to be
encoded as url-safe string. That means all '/' has to be replaced with
colons ':' and '.' has to be replaced with '~'.

For example,  repository with fullname `versioneye/veye` has to transformed
to `versioneye:veye`.

get.description: On Swagger, you can create session by adding additional parameter :api_key.
shows comments of authorized user

get.summary: shows the packages you are following
get.description: shows the packages you are following

200.description: shows the packages you are following

get.summary: shows unread notifications of authorized user
get.description:
This Endpoint returns the 30 latest notifications.

If there are new versions out there for software packages you follow directly on VersionEye, then
each new version is a new **notification** for your account.

200.description: shows unread notifications of authorized user

get.summary: Returns the list of organisations you have access to
get.description: This endpoint requires the API key from a user. The result is a set of organisations and their API keys.

200.description: Returns the list of organisations you have access to

get.summary: Returns the inventory list of the organisation
get.description: Find a detailed description here: https://github.com/versioneye/versioneye-api/blob/master/docs/api/v2/organisation.md

parameters.name: post_filter
parameters.description: Post processing filter. Possible values are 'ALL', 'duplicates_only', 'show_duplicates'

200.description: Returns the inventory list of the organisation

parameters.name: inventory_diff_id
parameters.description: ID of the inventory diff object

post.description:
This Endpoint takes 2 inventory filters and calculates the difference between them.
The diff object contains wich items have been removed and/or added compared to the inventory1 filter.
The response of this Endpoint is the ID of the diff object, which is calculated async in the background.

f1_project_version.description: Inventory1, filter down by project version

f1_post_filter.description: Inventory1, post processing filter. Possible values are 'ALL', 'duplicates_only', 'show_duplicates'

f2_project_version.description: Inventory2, filter down by project version

f2_post_filter.description: Inventory2, post processing filter. Possible values are 'ALL', 'duplicates_only', 'show_duplicates'

get.description: Returns the list of projects
Returns the list of teams

This resource returns same results as our web application. But you get it as JSON objects -
the result is an JSON array of product objects.

When there's no match for the query, the result array will be empty.

parameters.name: lang
parameters.description:
Filter results by programming languages;
                                  For filtering multiple languages submit a comma separated list of language strings.

parameters.name: g
parameters.description: Filter by GroupID. This is Java/Maven specific

get.description: This Endpoint expects a SHA value and returns the corresponding product to it, if available.

Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

  * API returns 404, when the product with given product key doesnt exists.

  * Response 302 means that you didnt encode prod_key correctly.* (Replace all dots & slashes ) *

Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

This resource will returns the status code 404 if there is no product
for the given prod_key.

post.description:
Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

It will respond 404, when you are using wrong product key or encode it uncorrectly.

get.description:
It returns the references of a package.

Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

This resource will return the status code 404 if there is no product for
the given prod_key or the product has 0 references.

Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

  * API returns 404, when the product with given product key doesnt exists.

  * Response 302 means that you didnt encode prod_key correctly.* (Replace all dots & slashes ) *

post.summary: suggest a license for an artifact
post.description: With this endpoint users can suggest a license for an artifact.

license_source.description: source of the license. Where did you find it?

comments.description: you wanna say anyting important to this license?

201.description: suggest a license for an artifact

post.summary: upload scm changelogs to an artifact
post.description:
This resource can parse a changelog.xml from the maven-changelog-plugin, assign
it to a specific artifact and display the changelog infos on the product page.

Please replace all slashes `/` through colons `:` and all dots `.` through `~`!

Example: The clojure package `yummy.json/json` has to be transformed to  `yummy~json:json`.

#### Notes about status codes

It will respond 404, when you are using wrong product key or encode it uncorrectly.

201.description: upload scm changelogs to an artifact

get.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

parameters.name: orga_name
parameters.description: The name of the organisation the project is assigned to.

parameters.name: team_name
parameters.description: The name of the team in the organisation this project is assigned to.

post.summary: upload project file and create a new project
post.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

visibility.description: By default 'public'. If 'public' everybody can see the project.

name.description: The name of the VersionEye project. By default it is the filename.

orga_name.description: The name of the organisation this project should be assigned to.

team_name.description: The name of the team in the organisation this project should be assigned to.

temp.description: If 'true' this project will not show up in the UI and gets removed later.

201.description: upload project file and create a new project

get.summary: merge a project into another one
get.description:
This endpoint merges a project (child_id) into another project (group_id/artifact_id).
This endpoint is specially for Maven based projects!
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

200.description: merge a project into another one

get.summary: merge a project into another one
get.description:
This endpoint merges a project (child_id) into another project (parent_id).
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

200.description: merge a project into another one

get.description:
This endpoint unmerges a project (child_id) from another project (parent_id). It makes the
chilld again a separate project!
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"
It shows detailed info of your project.

put.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

With this Endpoint an existing project can be updated. This are the fields which 
can be updated: 

```
{
  public: false,
  name: "toto",
  description: "beschreibung",
  license: "Lizenz",
  version: "Versionio"
}
```

post.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

delete.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

parameters.name: project_key
parameters.description: Delete project with given project ID.

get.summary: get a list of ALL dependencies
get.description:
This Endpoint returns a list of ALL dependencies of the project. This list includes
dependencies of child projects as well.

To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

200.description: get a list of ALL dependencies

get.summary: get grouped view of licences for dependencies
get.description:
To use this resource you need either an active session or you have to append
your API Key to the URL as parameter. For example: "?api_key=666_your_api_key_666"

200.description: get grouped view of licences for dependencies

get.summary: returns session info for authorized users
get.description:
If current user has active session, then this
method will return 200 with short user profile.
For othercase, it will return error message with status code 401.

200.description: returns session info for authorized users

post.description: You need to append your api_key to request.

delete.summary: delete current session aka log out.
delete.description: Close current session. It's very handy method when you re-generated your current API-key.

204.description: delete current session aka log out.

post.description: You need to append your api_key to request.
